conclusion: Points A, B, and C at the top will release liquid
The liquid will flow downward, interacting with various angled baffles
Determine if each liquid stream ends up at container D or E at the bottom
Liquid from A will first encounter the orange baffle that slants downward from top-right to bottom-left
Orange baffle will redirect the liquid flow toward the left side
Liquid may interact with the white horizontal baffle
White baffle would primarily slow liquid rather than change direction
Liquid from A would continue toward the left side
Path leads toward container D at the bottom left
Liquid from B will flow straight down initially
Liquid might interact with the yellow baffle in the lower right quadrant
Yellow baffle is angled to direct flow slightly leftward
Liquid would continue toward the center or slightly left of center
Path would lead the liquid toward container D
Liquid from C will first encounter the mint/turquoise baffle that slants downward from top-left to bottom-right
Mint/turquoise baffle will redirect the liquid flow toward the right side
Liquid may then encounter the yellow baffle
Yellow baffle would slightly redirect it leftward, but likely remain on the right half
Path leads toward container E
Liquid from point A will flow into container D
Liquid from point B will flow into container D
Liquid from point C will flow into container E
